all_fields.description: Include all fields in the output, ignoring output_fields

all_numeric_objectives.description: If true, appends all numeric fields to objective_fields.

address.description: For MSG callbacks, the mailbox address to use

delay.description: Seed for an initial random delay before first call, in millisecs.  The actual delay is this value plus a random number in [0, 1000)

fire_once.description: A flag specifying whether callbacks should be called at most once, even if the job is requeued and retraces previous states

order.description: Trigger ordering.  Smaller (or nil) orders are triggered first, with progress callbacks taking preference over state callbacks.  Synchronous and asynchronous callbacks are ordered independently.  Callbacks with the same order, states and synchronicity are triggered in the order they are received.

payload.description: The payload to be used as a message body

progress_variation.description: A number in (0, 1) which gives the variation in progress that will trigger this callback.

register-address.description: For MSG callbacks, whether to register the requested address if it does not yet exist (i.e., whether to create the associated message queue when the mailbox is RabbitMQ)

retries.description: Number of times the callback is retried on failures

retry_delay.description: Seed for a exponential back-off between retries, in millisecs

states.description: A list of states for which the callback should be called. If not given, the callback will be called for either the given progress variation or, if that's not provided, for all state changes

synchronous.description: A flag specifying wether the callback is synchronous and we need to wait for a remote response before proceeding

timeout.description: Lapse in millisecs waiting for the callback to get a response

url.description: The URL to invoke with the method above

class.description: Category to be considered the positive class

k.description: Minimum number of occurrences of positive class

class.description: Category to be considered the positive class

k.description: Minimum number of occurrences of positive class

confidence.description: Whether to include the confidence of each prediction

confidence_name.description: Name for the confidence column in header

dataset_id.description: Identifier of this model's main dataset

dataset_ids.description: Identifiers of this model's additional datasets

default_numeric_value.description: Catch-all missing filler for numeric fields.

default_values.description: A map for field identifiers to values for missing entries.

pretty.description: Whether edge boundaries are rounded values

trim.description: Proportion of data to trim from outer edges of distribution

type.description: Discretize into bins of equal width or population

discretization.description: Parameters to control the discetization of numeric fields

fields.description: Possibly partial list of descriptors for fields used in the model

fields_map.description: Mapping of dataset field ids to model field id

fields_maps.description: List of two-element arrays, where the first is a dataset ID and the second is a field map; to be used with dataset_ids

header.description: Whether to include a header with field names

importance.description: Whether to include the field importance scores (iforest)

kind.description: The kind of this message's body

missing_strategies.description: List of two-element arrays, where the first is a model ID and the second is a missing_strategy; to be used with model_ids

missing_strategy.description: A missing strategy to supplant that of all models

missing_tokens.description: Default tokens that represent a missing value

missing_value.description: String to be used to denote 'no prediction'

model_ids.description: Identifiers of the models to be evaluated, combining their predictions with the combiners specified by :combiner or :combiners

newline.description: Newline character: either lf (default) or crlf

auto_generated.description: True if the field was generated from another field

child_ids.description: IDs of the children if this generates other fields

datatype.description: The storage type of the field

description.description: Free text description of the field

label.description: A label for the field (free text for use by clients)

parent_ids.description: IDs of the parents if this is a generated field

preferred.description: Whether the field is used by default for model creation

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts. Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values

kurtosis.description: The sample kurtosis for numeric fields

mean.description: The sample mean for numeric fields

median.description: The approximate median for numeric fields

population.description: # of instances containing data for this field

skewness.description: The sample skewness for numeric fields

standard_deviation.description: The sample standard deviation for numeric fields

sum_squares.description: Sum of squared values (for variance calculation)

variance.description: The sample variance for numeric fields

auto_generated.description: True if the field was generated from another field

child_ids.description: IDs of the children if this generates other fields

datatype.description: The storage type of the field

description.description: Free text description of the field

label.description: A label for the field (free text for use by clients)

parent_ids.description: IDs of the parents if this is a generated field

preferred.description: Whether the field is used by default for model creation

average_length.description: The average # of chars for non-missing values

tag_cloud.description: Top terms with number of occurences

term_forms.description: Dictionary of multi-form terms to all forms seen

case_sensitive.description: Defines whether the term analysis is case sensitive

enabled.description: Enable/disables term analysis for this field

excluded_terms.description: A list of terms to ignore when performing term analysis

language.description: Language code for detected language, or 'none' for no detection, or nil to let us detect it.

stem_words.description: Defines whether the term analysis stems words

token_mode.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses full terms, tokenized terms, or both

use_stopwords.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses stop words

time_formats.description: Formats of times in this field from clj-time

description.description: Free text description of the field

pruning_strategy.description: Strategy used to select items when item_limit is surpassed

separator.description: Character delimiting items in the field. Set to null to autodetect if there is no regular expression.

separator_regexp.description: Regular expression delimiting items in the field. Overrides item_separator.

target_frequency.description: A ratio in (0, 1] with the occurence rate used when the prunning_strategy is nearest_to_frequency

item_analysis.description: Parameters controlling how items are extracted from text

objective_field_descriptor.description: The full descriptor of the objective field, when there's only one.

objective_weights.description: For classification models, this maps the objective classes to class weights

positive_class.description: The class the threshold applies to

operating_point.description: An operating point to perform predictions based on a threshold

positive_class.description: The class the threshold applies to

operating_points.description: A list of operating points to perform predictions based   on thresholds.

address.description: For MSG callbacks, the mailbox address to use

delay.description: Seed for an initial random delay before first call, in millisecs.  The actual delay is this value plus a random number in [0, 1000)

fire_once.description: A flag specifying whether callbacks should be called at most once, even if the job is requeued and retraces previous states

order.description: Trigger ordering.  Smaller (or nil) orders are triggered first, with progress callbacks taking preference over state callbacks.  Synchronous and asynchronous callbacks are ordered independently.  Callbacks with the same order, states and synchronicity are triggered in the order they are received.

payload.description: The payload to be used as a message body

progress_variation.description: A number in (0, 1) which gives the variation in progress that will trigger this callback.

register-address.description: For MSG callbacks, whether to register the requested address if it does not yet exist (i.e., whether to create the associated message queue when the mailbox is RabbitMQ)

retries.description: Number of times the callback is retried on failures

retry_delay.description: Seed for a exponential back-off between retries, in millisecs

states.description: A list of states for which the callback should be called. If not given, the callback will be called for either the given progress variation or, if that's not provided, for all state changes

synchronous.description: A flag specifying wether the callback is synchronous and we need to wait for a remote response before proceeding

timeout.description: Lapse in millisecs waiting for the callback to get a response

url.description: The URL to invoke with the method above

output_callbacks.description: List of callbacks for the generated dataset

output_dataset.description: Whether to create a dataset from the result

output_dataset_id.description: The identifier of the generated dataset

output_dataset_location.description: The location of the generated dataset

output_fields.description: List of identifiers of fields to include in output

output_file.description: Name of the file to store the output

output_store.description: Full URI to the store where the final output file will be stored

prediction_name.description: Name for the prediction column in header

preview.description: A preview of the output initial rows, as a list of lists of strings

preview_rows.description: Maximum number of preview rows in response

probabilities.description: Whether to include class probabilities in classification predictions

probability.description: Whether to include the probability of the predicted class in classification predictions (when the model supports it)

probability_name.description: Name for the confidence column in header

row_ranges.description: Rows used to build this model, per dataset

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

samples.description: A list of sample specifications, as pairs dataset id and sample

separator.description: Separator to use for the output CSV (only the first character is used)

votes.description: Whether to include predictions (and confidences, if `confidence` is requested) for each individual model
